H0.text: What technical word is given usually to the right-side odd-numbered page of a book. Verso

H1.text: What technical word is given usually to the right-side odd-numbered page of a book. Folio

H2.text: What technical word is given usually to the right-side odd-numbered page of a book. Rectangular

H3.text: What technical word is given usually to the right-side odd-numbered page of a book. Recto

A4.text: In book publishing convention, the first page of a book, and sometimes of each section and chapter of a book, is a recto page, and hence all recto pages will have odd numbers and all verso pages will have even numbers.

A5.text: Recto is the 'right' or 'front' side and verso is the 'left' or 'back' side when text is written or printed on a leaf of paper
